name: Nevis Bank Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 nights over the bank holidays. The room, although small, was tastefully decorated and had a comfortable bed. Very clean and modern bathroom with great shower. High speed free wifi throughout. Not much of a view from the room though. Parking outside the hotel with an "overspill" car park just across the road. Friendly helpful staff.
reviews.title: Lovely modern inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was tasty. We had dinner in the restaurant both nights - slightly disappointing. The starters were good, and whilst the main courses had a decent portion size, it was way over seasoned with salt and sauce.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel in Beautiful Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would definately stay here again.
reviews.title: Modern, clean rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 nights and the service was exceptionally good. The staff just so friendly and helpful and nothing was too much trouble! Room was clean and comfortable, freshly painted as well. Breakfast was great - full cooked Scottish which was delicious. Also had a very nice dinner in the restaurant one night. Seeing that I was Australian, the barman gave me an ice-bucket for my beer bottle. How good is that!!! They also gave us a cut lunch to have on the train after we left, which was exceptionally good value for money.
reviews.title: short break in fort william
Fantastic Hotel
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night in August and couldn't have been more pleased. The room was a decent size, very clean, and modern. The only complaint was no ventilation in the bathroom so when you take a shower you must keep the door closed or risk setting off the fire alarm with the steam, which happened to us. But otherwise this place is a gem. We didn't get a chance to eat at the restaurant but it was crowded and looked enticing. Do not hesitate to book here, you will not be disappointed if you have high standards.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: A short touring holiday in The Highlands in mid-December sounds like insanity but it turned out to be such a great choice.
reviews.title: A Welcome Return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the Nevis Bank hotel in October 2011 and was impressed by the whole experience. So, without hesitation, I booked again, for this trip.
reviews.title: Pleasant Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Apart from the Christmas dinners organized by local businesses and clubs (which in no way spoiled the atmosphere in the restaurant because they were so well behaved), we pretty much had the hotel to ourselves.
reviews.title: Nice and comfortable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: During the day, we drove around the area visiting beautiful, Wintery places, stopping to take photographs and enjoy the views.
reviews.title: Very good but plain

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At the end of day, it was lovely to come back to a warm, welcoming room with the choice of a bath or shower to warm up and then look forwards to an excellent meal in the restaurant and conversation in the lounge/bar area.
reviews.title: Wonderful Service and beautiful Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed for one night before riding the Jacobite Steam train. The hotel is about a 1/2 mile walk from the train station on some narrow sidewalks. We stayed in the special needs room. It was very clean, newly remodeled, had lots of electrical outlets. Our room was quiet, although our friends, who stayed in the other part of the hotel, told us their room was not so quiet. We had dinner and breakfast here. Both were good.
reviews.title: Comfortable, quiet room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012
reviews.text: We were welcomed by a very friendly receptionist who showed us to our room. Room was nicely furnished and hotel generally was of a high standard. Dinner and breakfast also highly recommended. Great location too, only a short walk to the town centre and on the doorstep of Ben Nevis.
reviews.title: Lovely rooms and great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Nevis Bank Inn during a short trip to Fort William. The hotel was clean and modern. The beds were comfortable and there was plenty of storage in the room. The bathroom was also very clean, and both the bedroom and bathroom were a decent size.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast in the hotel was lovely. We also ate in the hotel one evening and would thoroughly recommend the restaurant to anyone staying.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: All of the staff were very friendly and helpful, and the hotel was in a good location - only 5/10 minute walk from the centre of the town.
reviews.title: Great find!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night, sat 27th Oct. The staff were very friendly and so helpful, room was lovely, not a great view, but very clean and a comfortable bed. The food in the evening was excellent and breakfast in the morning superb too. We went from here down to cameron house and wished we had stayed here longer
reviews.title: Wish we had stayed longer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: Despite the postcode problems with SatNav, a call to the hotel gave me some good directions. I arrived to find a clean, modern, well furnished hotel. Excellent, helpful staff and the restaurant food was delicious.
reviews.title: Nevis Bank Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed two nights [wed.24th Oct and thurs 25th oct 2012 ] last week and felt the Nevis Bank deserved a recommendation. Lovely modern room, comfortable bed,an excellent shower with bath and hot towels.
reviews.title: Two nights at Nevis Bank

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The evening meal [we both had duck] was excellent. The dining room was very busy even midweek which speaks for itself.
reviews.title: 3 night stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent Thursday on the Steam train to Mallaig.........a long awaited pleasure......not before we enjoyed a very good breakfast. Staff friendly and helpful too.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011
reviews.text: We had a lovely night here & wonderful meal.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was very nice but very hot!
reviews.title: Great service from the moment I made the reservation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would stay again & recommend
reviews.title: Best meals we had during our 2 week vacation in the UK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were traveling on our own thru Scotland and I spent a lot of time planning our route and accomadations. Spoke with Bernadine to insure we would have a twin bedded room and from the very start I was impressed with the hospitality. It lived up to my expectations; the hotel and restaurant were very good. It has been ecently remodeled and everything was in great condition and spotless.
reviews.title: The best seafood

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room at the Nevis Bank was small but attractively furnished & spotlessly clean. The bathroom was large & modern. Our only complaint was that even after we were taken to the linen closet to look for ourselves, the hotel doesn't provide washcloths or have them available on request. Brown's, the attached restaurant, was absolutely superb. Both my husband & I had fresh seafood for dinner, & the complementary cooked to order breakfast was hearty & perfectly prepared.
reviews.title: excellent room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found this new hotel to be very clean, smartly appointed, and well located. Unfortunately, we had a very bad experience there. My husband and I booked a suite for two nights in April, 2011(a four month advanced reservation for which we paid 68% upfront). Upon arrival, we were told that "someone" had called and said that we would not be arriving until the following evening and that they had given our suite away for the first night. The alleged caller could not be identified. We found this to be utterly proposterous. After some negotiations witht the receptionist there(the only person available we could talk to), we reluctantly agreed to stay in a standard room the first night and then be moved to our original and confirmed suite the following night. We agreed with the receptionist that we would pay the standard room rate for the suite as a recompense for their mistake. The standard room turned out to be too warm(my husband didn't sleep all night) with a very loud fan in the bathroom. We also requested some face cloths which we were told would be delivered but never were until I requested them a 3rd time.More on the towel issue later. We tolerated the aggravation and looked forward to our suite the second night. The suite was indeed larger but was inconveniently located. The bedroom was right next to the parking lot which did not provide adequate privacy unless you closed the window and the shade. You needed to punch in some numbers on a lock in order to enter the hallway to the suite and then unlock your door. This was very inconvenient. The window in the living room overlooked trash cans. When we checked out the next day, we were again surprised that the agreement we had made with the receptionist for the price of the room had not been honored and we needed to spend our vacation time haggling again for them to honor our agreement which they did finally honor. In addition, this hotel has no face clothes(apparently they hunted some down for us) and limited parking. We found the attitude of management to be negative and dishonest.
reviews.title: Not so fast....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: I stayed one night in this hotel on the way to Skye, and what a gem it was. The place was spotless and really modern. Staff were very friendly and helpful. All in all I would definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: Lovely, spotlessly clean hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel on the 10th and 11th August
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Friendly Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Newly refurbished hotel, great room, free internet access, friendly & helpful staff
reviews.title: Brilliant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would highly recommend
reviews.title: great end to west highland way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Don't be put off by the dreadful Google Maps Street-view images, the Nevis Bank Inn. Thankfully, it has metamorphosed from the boarded up image on Google to a fabulously renovated hotel/inn under new ownership, with clean, well-appointed rooms and a great restaurant serving top-quality food.
reviews.title: "The" place to stay in Fort William

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: The staff are very helpful and make you feel really welcome.
reviews.title: Nice, modern hotel in a small town with little choice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Goodness only knows where we would have had to stay had the Nevis Bank not turned into a beautiful butterfly!
reviews.title: Excellent good location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As always people, trust Trip Advisor.
reviews.title: Good but pricey

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for two nights whilst visiting the area to climb Ben Nevis.
reviews.title: What a Great Place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Six of us had two nights together celebrating my ** birthday on 8 Sep. The hotel, recently rebuilt, is furnished to a superb standard throughout. Furthermore, all of us were seriously impressed with both the cuisine and the friendliness and helpful attitude of owners and staff alike - during and after our visit (when two of us had left items behind). The ambience in a very busy dining room on a Wednesday and Thursday night was truly exceptional and contributed significantly to a delightful stay in this excellent hotel.
reviews.title: Outstanding Birthday Celebration for 6 of us

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011
reviews.text: We stayed in Ft William to do the Steam Railway experience to Mallaig and we are all trying to think of another excuse to stay there again!
reviews.title: Excellent service, excellent food!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Recently stayed in this hotel as I was climbing Ben Nevis for charity and the location, service, food and overall experience was excellent.
reviews.title: Nice rooms but Not 4 star service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: They have got it right with this hotel, it's not too big where they loose touch with things, and not too small where they can be annoying!
reviews.title: Very nice place to stay, so close to Ben Nevis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: If you are ever in Fort William, well recommend a visit!
reviews.title: Full Marks to the Nevis Bank Inn

description: Unpack, unwind & enjoy!We offer modern comfortable accommodation. Our bedrooms have been designed with you in mind and you will find everything required for a relaxing stay.Rooms are stylishly decorated using walnut wood furniture & luxury fabrics. * Single rooms have double beds * Double rooms have king-size or super king beds * Twin rooms and rooms for guests with mobility difficulties are also available. * Suites have super king beds and lounges with double sofa beds.
